text: Clerk
Motion
Motion
Motion
Motion
Motion
Motion

This one...!
But then again... this one looks delicious too...!
Hmm...
It's rare to see you pondering at the store.

Yes...! I was planning to get the usual
cookie sandwich chocolate.

but... I saw the new one-bite chocolate tart, and it looked delicious...
I'm sorry for taking so long...

Haha, don't apologize.
I'm happy if you take your time to decide until you're satisfied.
Bringing gifts is important, after all!
Yes...
(The Art of Chocolate Idol Gift-Giving)
(Using sweets that involve chocolate is a must.)

(Even if you've decided on a reliable classic,
always keep an eye out for new releases.)
(...Something like that, maybe?)
I'm sorry!

Could I please have the assortment of
cookie sandwiches, the largest one?
Certainly.
(Oh, sticking with the usual today?)
Also, I'll take two of the one-bite chocolate tarts individually, please.

Of course.
I'll handle the payment over there.
Yes!
(...The individual ones are for research purposes.)
Here you go!

No problem.
Let me hold them for you.
Oh, thank you...!

Haha, you're welcome.
...You went with the usual, huh?

Yes.
The tart had nuts in it.

?
Chiyoko, you're okay with nuts...?

Hehe, I'm fine with them!
But I heard Okuyama-san doesn't like them.

Okuyama-san...?
...Ah, the AD!

That's right!
It's sad when someone can't enjoy food, right?

(...Even though we just met the other day,
already learning about their preferences...)

And I also thought it might be better to wait
until actually tasting it before giving it to someone.

So it's like I should have gone with the first choice from the
beginning, right? But it looked so delicious, so I hesitated...

I only bought some for tasting this time!
Let's study together later!

Yeah, thanks.
Looking forward to it.
(...The Art of Chocolate Idol Gift-Giving)

(Considering the preferences of the person receiving the gift, and
therefore, not neglecting to gather information on the people involved.)

...Alright, next, something savory.
In this department store... Wasn't it rice balls?

Yes!
I wonder if they still have the simmered egg rice balls!

(Preparing something else for those who don't
like chocolate... I truly admire your thoughtfulness...)
